intro: Cercanthemum lanceolatum, commonly known as the narrowleaf thornapple, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is characterized by its lance-shaped leaves and produces clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. It belongs to the family Apocynaceae, which includes many species with milky sap. The plant's unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
